description: From Middle English beel, bele, from Old English bȳle (“boil, carbuncle, bile”), from Proto-Germanic *būlijǭ (“swelling”), from *būlǭ (“swelling, bump, boil”). More at boil.

entries.meaning: (dialectal or obsolete) A small inflammatory tumor; pustule.

verbs.description: beal (third-person singular simple present beals, present participle bealing, simple past and past participle bealed)

entries.meaning: (dialectal, chiefly Scotland, Western Pennsylvania) To gather matter; swell; come to a head, as a pimple; fester; suppurate.
